alert.note: Alert for Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 6:53PM CST until March 03 at 2:21AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Pearl River County and Washington Parish. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Pearl River Near Pearl River affecting St. Tammany Parish, Washington Parish, and Hancock County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Bogalusa. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Woodlands and crop acreage along the river will be flooded. The Bogue Chitto Wildlife Management area will be inundated with water in recreational camps and over access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 11.1 feet Sunday, March 12. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
